description.narrative: The development objective of the Sindh Agricultural Growth Project for Pakistan is to improve the productivity and market access of small and medium producers in important commodity value chains. The project comprises of three components. The first component, capacity building and institutional development will finance capacity building of producers through technology development, technology dissemination, training, and exposure. It includes following three sub-components: (i) capacity building of producers; (ii) modernization of extension services and agricultural research; and (iii) strategic planning for the agricultural sector. The second component, investment for agricultural growth will finance specific investments in the horticulture and dairy value chains and a targeted investment to reduce post-harvest loss among small-holder rice growers. It will also finance a demand driven innovation fund to support farmers and producers with technology innovations in the selected value chains. It includes following four sub-components: (i) horticulture value chains; (ii) rice post-harvest loss management; (iii) dairy value chain; and (iv) demand driven innovation fund. The third component, project management and monitoring and evaluation will finance costs for: (i) project management units (PMUs), project coordinator's office, and project implementation units (PIUs); (ii) third party monitoring; (iii) implementation of environment and social management framework (ESMF) and pest management plan (PMP) and development of social assessment; and (iv) rigorous impact evaluation to attribute causality to project interventions.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plans and Budgets to be prepared for each subsequent year | Description :No Later than April 30 eachyear | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Establish and maintain the arrangements for Internal Auditing for the Project | Description :The procurementprocess for hiring of Internal Auditors is yet to begin. | Due Date :31-Jul-2014
Finance Agreement :Establishment of Project Coordination Unit in Planning & Development Department | Description :Full time ProjectCoordinator is still to be appointed. | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Establishment of Project Management Unit in Department of Agriculture | Description :An interim Project Directorwas nominated by the government during preparation. The Full time Project Director needs to be appointed now that the project isapproved and made effective. | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Establishment of Project Management Unit in Department of Livestock & Fisheries | Description :An interimProject Director was nominated by the government during preparation. The Full time Project Director needs to be appointed now thatthe project is approved and made effective. Hiring of other staff has been advertised. | Due Date :31-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Establishment of the Project Steering Committee | Description :This covenant is due three months aftereffectiveness, however a Project Steering Committee has already been established through government notification dated February 4,2014. | Due Date :30-Nov-2014
Finance Agreement :Project to be implemented in accordance with the Operations Manual | Description :Detailed procedure toimplement FA method are prepared. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Project to be implemented pursuant to the safeguard instruments (ESMP & IPMP) | Description :Detailed EMPs areprepared. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
